intro: Thlaspi pollichii, commonly known as the Pollich's cabbages, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants known for their cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its small, green leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Thlaspi pollichii is often found in high-altitude ecosystems, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
